modals.title: BirthRide
modals.description: As a part of my capstone project for Lambda School, I teamed up with 5 developers to create an application for a Ugandan non-profit. The objective of the application is to facilitate communication between in-labor mothers and motorcycle ambulance drivers.Being 1 of 3 web developers on the team, we focused on building a RESTful API that our Web, Andriod and IOS teams could all access. We integrated the Google Maps API and Twilio to provide accurate distance data and immediate contact for those requesting a ride and being requested. Lastly, we integrated the Material UI library to provide our interface a basic but clean look so that our users can have a stress free time when registering or when requesting one of the biggest rides of their lives.

modals.title: Donor Management
modals.description: Over a week-long period, I served as a backend architect to construct an application for organizations to manage their donations. This was my first time working as a backend developer on a team, so I prioritized getting my RESTful API running ASAP so our frontend had data to use. During this project, I learned a lot about the detail one needs to provide as a backend developer. Itâ€™s not enough just to create routes and databases, but being able to articulate why and how someone uses that software is just as important as being able to build it.

modals.title: Guidr
modals.description: Over a week-long period, I served as a frontend architect to construct an application for outdoorsmen and backcountry guides to catalog their journeys and connect with fellow guides. This was my first exposure to working as part of a team and rely on a backend developer's API to help achieve our goal. Ultimately, it was a fantastic experience and I learned a lot about what it takes to be a frontend developer on a larger development team. Additionally, by utilizing technologies such as React, Redux, and Axios I further cemented my previous learnings in a dynamic and fresh environment.

truths.question: I was not born in the United States.
truths.answer: I was born in London, England!

truths.question: I once, unknowingly, slept on top of a lizard.
truths.answer: Long story, but it wasn't pretty...

truths.question: I've taken a train lasting over 24 hours.
truths.answer: The summer I spent in India we took a train from Chiplun to Kochi in Kerala. It took over 24+ hours but was worth every second.

truths.question: I can play 6 songs on the Banjo.
truths.answer: Cripple Creek, Banjo in the Holla, Boil them Cabbage Down, You are my sunshine, Foggy Mountain Breakdown, and Wagon Wheel

truths.question: I've never had a favorite sports team win a championship.
truths.answer: Jets, Mets, and Knicks remain undefeated in breaking my heart every year.

truths.question: I've been featured on Cleveland local news as stock footage
truths.answer: I was caught walking around Oberlin College Campus. 30 minutes outside Cleveland.

lies.question: I used to act in commercials as a teen.
lies.answer: Though I did act a bit in highschool, I was never 'big time'.

lies.question: I've never seen a Broadway musical.
lies.answer: I've seen a few! Most notably The Lion King and Mamma Mia.

lies.question: I once shared an airplane aisle with celebrity chef Gordon Ramsey.
lies.answer: So absurd it must be true right? Unfortunately not, but maybe one day Gordon and I will share a plane.

lies.question: I once went swimming in NYC's East River.
